TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract sealed beforefieldinit Volatile extends System.Object
public ref class Volatile abstract sealed

summary.span: 包含用于执行可变内存操作的方法。

span.span: Contains methods for performing volatile memory operations.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 在多处理器系统上，可变写入操作可确保写入内存位置的值将立即可见的所有处理器。On a multiprocessor system, a volatile write operation ensures that a value written to a memory location is immediately visible to all processors. 易失性的读取的操作将获取由任何处理器写入的内存位置的最新值。A volatile read operation obtains the very latest value written to a memory location by any processor. 这些操作可能需要刷新处理器缓存，这可能会影响性能。These operations might require flushing processor caches, which can affect performance. > [!NOTE] > 在单处理器系统中，易失性读取和写入确保值为读取或写入到内存中并不缓存 （例如，在处理器寄存器中）。On a uniprocessor system, volatile reads and writes ensure that a value is read or written to memory and not cached (for example, in a processor register). 因此，这些操作可用于同步对可由另一个线程或通过硬件更新字段的访问。Thus, you can use these operations to synchronize access to a field that can be updated by another thread or by hardware. 易失性内存操作都是同步的针对特殊情况，其中正常锁定不是同步的可接受的替代方法。Volatile memory operations are for special cases of synchronization, where normal locking is not an acceptable alternative. 在正常情况下，C#`lock`语句，Visual Basic`SyncLock`语句，并类提供的同步访问数据，最简单且最容易出错的方法和类提供了一个简单方法，可以编写迟缓初始化代码不直接使用仔细查过锁定。Under normal circumstances, the C# `lock` statement, the Visual Basic `SyncLock` statement, and the class provide the easiest and least error-prone way of synchronizing access to data, and the class provides a simple way to write lazy initialization code without directly using double-checked locking. 和方法启用中语言不支持的功能。The and methods enable functionality that is not supported in languages. 例如:For example: - 某些语言，例如，Visual Basic 中，不能识别易失性内存操作的概念。Some languages, such as Visual Basic, do not recognize the concept of volatile memory operations. 类提供了此类语言中的此功能。The class provides that functionality in such languages. > [!NOTE] > 调用这些方法之一，会影响单个内存访问。Calling one of these methods affects only a single memory access. 若要提供有效字段的同步，请对该字段的所有访问必须都使用和。To provide effective synchronization for a field, all access to the field must use and . - 在C#，并使用`volatile`字段上的修饰符可保证每次访问该字段是易失性内存的操作，但`volatile`修饰符不能应用于数组元素。In C#, using the `volatile` modifier on a field guarantees that every access to that field is a volatile memory operation, but the `volatile` modifier cannot be applied to array elements. 和方法适用于数组元素。The and methods can be used on array elements.

span.span: volatile keyword (C# Reference)

summary.span: 读取字段值。

span.span: Reads the value of a field.

summary.span: 在需要它的系统上，插入一个内存屏障，阻止处理器对内存操作重新排序，如下所示：如果在代码中读取或写入出现在此方法之后，处理器不能将其移到此方法之前。

span.span: On systems that require it, inserts a memory barrier that prevents the processor from reordering memory operations as follows: If a read or write appears after this method in the code, the processor cannot move it before this method.

.method public static hidebysig bool Read(bool& location) cil managed
Public Shared Function Read (ByRef location As Boolean) As Boolean
public: static bool Read(bool % location);
static member Read : -> bool

span.span: This value is the latest written by any processor in the computer, regardless of the number of processors or the state of processor cache.

summary.span: 在需要它的系统上，插入一个内存屏障，阻止处理器对内存操作重新排序，如下所示：如果在代码中读取或写入出现此方法之前，处理器不能将其移到此方法之后。

span.span: On systems that require it, inserts a memory barrier that prevents the processor from reordering memory operations as follows: If a read or write appears before this method in the code, the processor cannot move it after this method.
